articles.author: Saqib Ahmed
articles.description: An epic rally in U.S. stocks has sent Wall Street's fear gauge to a post-pandemic low. Options strategists believe market gyrations may stay subdued for some time - potentially smoothing the way for further gains in equities.
articles.title: Stock-hungry volatility funds, ‘gamma-heavy' options dealers could buoy US equities

articles.author: Hannah Lang
articles.description: The cryptocurrency industry was on track to hit a new record for federal lobbying spending, after a year in which firms scrambled to repair their reputations and advance friendly legislation, according to data provided to Reuters by nonprofit research group OpenSecrets.
articles.title: US crypto industry lobby spending on track for new record in 2023

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The London Stock Exchange (LSEG.L) said on Tuesday regular activity had resumed after a brief outage affected its trading and information system and disrupted small-cap stock trades, the second such incident in less than two months.
articles.title: London stock market trading resumes after small cap outage

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ratings agency Moody's on Tuesday cut its outlook on China's government credit ratings to negative from stable, citing lower medium-term economic growth and risks from a major correction in the country's vast property sector.
articles.title: Moody's cuts China credit outlook to negative, cites lower growth, property risks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The downturn in euro zone business activity eased last month but still indicates the bloc's economy will contract again this quarter as the dominant services industry continues to struggle to generate demand, a survey showed.
articles.title: Fall in euro zone business activity adds to recession expectations

articles.author: Aditya Kalra, Munsif Vengattil
articles.description: Apple (AAPL.O) has told India its local production targets will be hit if New Delhi follows the European Union and requires existing iPhones to have universal charging ports, a government document shows as the U.S. tech giant lobbies for an exemption or delay.
articles.title: Exclusive: Apple warns India's EU-style charger rules will hit local production target

articles.author: Supantha Mukherjee
articles.description: AT&T (T.N) has chosen Ericsson (ERICb.ST) to build a telecom network using a new cost-cutting technology ORAN that will cover 70% of its wireless traffic in the United States by late 2026.
articles.title: Ericsson shares jump after AT&T deal win, Nokia drops

articles.author: Arafat Barbakh, Mohammad Salem
articles.description: Israeli forces pressed ahead with their air and ground bombardment of southern Gaza Strip, killing and wounding dozens of Palestinians, even as the United States and the United Nations repeatedly urged them to protect civilians.
articles.title: Israel intensifies southern Gaza offensive; US, UN urge civilian protections

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Maria Andreeva, whose husband has been fighting in Ukraine for more than a year, is also waging a battle in Moscow: to get him home.
articles.title: In Russia, some women demand return of their men from Ukraine front

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan
articles.title: Morning Bid: Small caps pick up baton, China rating hit
